subtitle.text: Dino-Mite!
Dino Discoveries:Meet the Dinosaurs
We’ve never seen real dinosaurs.
It's because they’re not alive now.
*carnivorous: meat-eating
*herbivorous: plant-eating
We can see dinosaurs in the movies.
And they must’ve been mostly enormous carnivorous dinosaurs.
But that isn’t all about dinosaurs.
There were also herbivorous dinosaurs.
*Dinosaurs lived during a time called the Mesozoic Era.
This era is divided into three periods: Triassic, Jurassic, and Cretaceous.
Dinosaurs lived a really long time ago.
*Dinosaurs lived throughout the world.
Fossils of dinosaurs have been found on every continent.
They weren’t around when people were here.
Some dinosaurs lived in hot places, while others didn’t.
Dino Discoveries:Meet the Dinosaurs
We’ve never seen real dinosaurs.
It’s because they’re not alive now.
We can see dinosaurs in the movies.
And they must’ve been mostly enormous carnivorous dinosaurs.
But that isn’t all about dinosaurs.
There were also herbivorous dinosaurs.
Dinosaurs lived a really long time ago.
They weren’t around when people were here.
Some dinosaurs lived in hot places, while others didn't.
Dino-Mite!
Dino Shapes and Sizes: From Big to Small
*Some were as small as chickens, like the Compsognathus.
*Others were huge, like the Brachiosaurus, which was as big as a building.
Dinosaurs came in many sizes.
Some were as small as chickens.
Others were as big as buildings.
What’s your favorite dinosaur?
Dinosaurs wouldn’t have been the same to each other.
That’s because they lived in different environments.
*Dinosaurs lived in a range of areas, from tropical forests to deserts.
Let’s name some dinosaurs you know.
Each dinosaur wasn’t the same, and all were unique.
Dinosaurs were believed to have been gray or green.
These colors would’ve helped them camouflage.
Dinosaur pictures usually don’t show feathers.
But fossils have proven that lots of dinosaurs had feathers.

Dino-Mite!
Dino Digs: Unearthing Fossils and Bones
Dinosaurs aren’t here anymore.
Some believe that an asteroid hit the Earth.
*The last dinosaurs died out about 65.5 million years ago.
That’s one of the ideas about why dinosaurs disappeared.
This could’ve made the Earth very dusty and dark.
Plants couldn’t grow, and dinosaurs couldn’t find food.
Others say dinosaurs aren’t really gone.
They say birds are like little dinosaurs.
They’ve feathers and lay eggs.
It’s just like some dinosaurs did.
Besides that, birds have a lot in common with Pterosaurs.
We can’t see dinosaurs now.
However, there’s still so much to discover about them.
We’ll have more challenges.
